segment.source: Walkthrough-- Implement shadow volumes using depth buffers in Direct3D 11
segment.target: Walkthrough-- Implement shadow volumes using depth buffers in Direct3D 11

segment.source: This walkthrough demonstrates how to render shadow volumes using depth maps, using Direct3D 11 on devices of all Direct3D feature levels.
segment.target: This walkthrough demonstrates how to render shadow volumes using depth maps, using Direct3D 11 on devices of all Direct3D feature levels.

segment.source: This walkthrough demonstrates how to render shadow volumes using depth maps, using Direct3D 11 on devices of all Direct3D feature levels.
segment.target: This walkthrough demonstrates how to render shadow volumes using depth maps, using Direct3D 11 on devices of all Direct3D feature levels.

segment.source: Description

segment.source: Create depth buffer device resources
segment.target: Create depth buffer device resources

segment.source: Learn how to create the Direct3D device resources necessary to support depth testing for shadow volumes.
segment.target: Learn how to create the Direct3D device resources necessary to support depth testing for shadow volumes.

segment.source: Render the shadow map to the depth buffer
segment.target: Render the shadow map to the depth buffer

segment.source: Render from the point of view of the light to create a two-dimensional depth map representing the shadow volume.
segment.target: Render from the point of view of the light to create a two-dimensional depth map representing the shadow volume.

segment.source: Render the scene with depth testing
segment.target: Render the scene with depth testing

segment.source: Create a shadow effect by adding depth testing to your vertex (or geometry) shader and your pixel shader.
segment.target: Create a shadow effect by adding depth testing to your vertex (or geometry) shader and your pixel shader.

segment.source: Support shadow maps on a range of hardware
segment.target: Support shadow maps on a range of hardware

segment.source: Render higher-fidelity shadows on faster devices and faster shadows on less powerful devices.
segment.target: Render higher-fidelity shadows on faster devices and faster shadows on less powerful devices.

segment.source: Shadow mapping application to Direct3D 9 desktop porting
segment.target: Shadow mapping application to Direct3D 9 desktop porting

segment.source: Windows 8 adde d depth comparison functionality to feature level 91 and 93.
segment.target: Windows 8 adde d depth comparison functionality to feature level 91 and 93.

segment.source: Now you can migrate rendering code with shadow volumes to DirectX 11, and the Direct3D 11 renderer will be downlevel compatible with feature level 9 devices.
segment.target: Now you can migrate rendering code with shadow volumes to DirectX 11, and the Direct3D 11 renderer will be downlevel compatible with feature level 9 devices.

segment.source: This walkthrough shows how any Direct3D 11 app or game can implement traditional shadow volumes using depth testing.
segment.target: This walkthrough shows how any Direct3D 11 app or game can implement traditional shadow volumes using depth testing.

segment.source: The code covers the following process:
segment.target: The code covers the following process:

segment.source: Creating Direct3D device resources for shadow mapping.
segment.target: Creating Direct3D device resources for shadow mapping.

segment.source: Adding a rendering pass to create the depth map.
segment.target: Adding a rendering pass to create the depth map.

segment.source: Adding depth testing to the main rendering pass.
segment.target: Adding depth testing to the main rendering pass.

segment.source: Implementing the necessary shader code.
segment.target: Implementing the necessary shader code.

segment.source: Options for fast rendering on downlevel hardware.
segment.target: Options for fast rendering on downlevel hardware.

segment.source: Upon completing this walkthrough, you should be familiar with how to implement a basic compatible shadow volume technique in Direct3D 11 that's compatible with feature level 91 and above.
segment.target: Upon completing this walkthrough, you should be familiar with how to implement a basic compatible shadow volume technique in Direct3D 11 that's compatible with feature level 91 and above.

segment.source: Prerequisites
segment.target: Prerequisites

segment.source: You should Prepare your dev environment for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) DirectX game development.
segment.target: You should Prepare your dev environment for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) DirectX game development.

segment.source: You don't need a template yet, but you'll need Microsoft Visual Studio 2015 to build the code sample for this walkthrough.
segment.target: You don't need a template yet, but you'll need Microsoft Visual Studio 2015 to build the code sample for this walkthrough.
